values:
Posted for the Summer Contest for Team Parental @ Spn_Spankings 

Word count: 1344.

Title/Rating: Camping
Team: Parental
Implement: Hand/Switch
Author: always_angel
Fandom: Supernatural
Characters: John, Sam, Dean
Disclaimer: Don't own, cause if I did John would still be alive.
Author's Notes/Warnings: Warning, use of a switch on minor kids but
nothing abusive.
Summary/Word Count: Sam and Dean wander into the woods and John finds
them.

Word count: 1344.







It was definitely not the best day John Winchester had ever had
standing there, with his two sons looking at him nervously. "Lying to
me, wandering off in the middle of the woods, and disobeying me about
staying put!" He yelled at them, trying to keep his temper in
check. "Dean, go cut me a switch." He ordered sternly.

"A s…switch? But dad come on…" Dean pleaded. "I said now Jonathan
Dean." He ordered sternly. Dean gave Sam a reassuring squeeze to his
shoulder, and went to cut a switch. Sam looked at John, tears falling
from his little face. "Daddy, we're really sorry…" He got out between
his tears. John sighed and looked at the eight year old, he hadn't
actually planned to give Sam more then one token swat as a warning
with the switch, but the kid didn't need to know that just yet.

"I know you're sorry Sammy, but you still disobeyed me kiddo." He
said more gently, sitting on a picnic table and pulling him into his
lap. "You could have gotten lost, and then daddy would have been very
sad and worried." He explained gently. "I don't want you sad daddy."
Sammy sobbed, holding onto him tightly. "Me either baby." John said
and hugged him as Dean trudged back over. With a small inward sigh
John stood Sam up. "Dean go wait in the tent." He ordered his twelve
year old.

"But dad…" Dean started, but stopped at the look on John's
face. "Sorry Sammy." He said guiltily, going into the tent. "Alright
Sam, let's get this over with." John told him as he noted Dean had
cleaned the switch, he set it beside him. Wasting no time he had his
jeans and underwear down, and Sam over his lap. He began to spank
firmly. "You do not wander off anywhere when I've told you to stay
put." He lectured as he landed several swats to the junction where
thigh and butt met.

"Owww owww daddddy, I won't…" Sammy sobbed, kicking his legs as the
heat in his behind grew. "Damn right you won't." John told him as he
landed several more swats to the now pink bottom that was rapidly
turning a more acceptable shade of red.



"Owwwwieeee!" Sammy wailed, crying and kicking his legs, trying to
escape to no avail. "Alright buddy, we're almost done here." John
told him and before Sam could protest, he raised the switch and
brought it down once on his behind. He had barely touched him with it
but he knew just the act itself would be enough for his little guy.
He wasn't disappointed as Sam let out a shriek like he'd been
murdered, and went limp sobbing over his lap. John set the switch
down and gently replaced Sam's clothes, then turned him, lifting him
into his arms for the much needed cuddle. "Shhh, it's okay baby;
daddy's got you." He soothed, holding the little boy close to his
chest as Sammy sobbed. "I…I s…sorry daddy.." Sammy wailed, crying
into his shirt. "Shhh, I know you are Sammy, I know." John soothed,
holding him. "And it's all forgiven, we're good baby." He promised,
knowing he needed to hear it and he didn't mind saying it at all.

It took several minutes until Sam had calmed down, and when he did
John lovingly wiped his tears and had him blow his nose into the
bandana he always carried in his back pocket. "Go wait in the tent
okay baby, and send Dean out." John instructed him gently,
refastening his jeans for him. "Yes sir.." Sam sniffled and went into
the tent. "Dean, daddy wants you." He sniffled.

Dean gulped, hearing Sam's spanking had him nervous as he was the
oldest and supposed to protect Sam. He walked out and shuffled over
to his dad nervously. "I'm really sorry dad." He said looking
down. "I know, but sorry means nothing if you or Sam had gotten hurt
Dean." John explained gently, lifting his chin. "I don't give you
orders to take away your fun kid, I give them to keep you safe." He
explained.

"Yes sir, I know." Dean said as he felt his eyes burn, but tried to
blink away the tears that formed. "Alright, let's get this done then;
jeans and underwear down." John ordered him. Dean sniffed and
unfastened his jeans, shoving them down to his knees he pulled his
underwear down next. John helped him over his lap and after wrapping
a strong arm around his waist, started to spank firmly. "When I give
you an order you follow it." John scolded, landing several swats to
his behind and alternating cheeks, getting more swats in on his
tender under curves. "Owww, owww dad I will.." Dean yelled as tears
started to fall. "Owww, come on, go easy would ya!" He yelled out at
a particularly stinging swat.

"It's supposed to hurt Dean." John commented dryly, landing several
more swats until Dean burst into tears. With a sad sigh John picked
up the switch. "Almost done champ." He promised and landed three
swats mildly. Barely hard enough to do more then sting. Dean let out
a shriek like Sam had, which surprised John as Dean was always the
more stoic of the two. It made him worry he'd hit him too hard, but
as he looked and saw no more then the faintest of red lines he knew
it was more the emotional pain of it then the physical. Tossing the
switch he gently replaced Dean's clothes, turning him into his arms.



"Shhh, I gotcha little dude it's okay." He soothed as Dean clung to
him crying. "Shhh, it's okay baby, it's all over and forgiven, we're
good champ." He promised, holding his baby tight and letting him cry
it out.

"I…I didn't m…mean.." Dean sobbed, burying his face in the crook of
John's neck. "Shhh, I know you didn't." John reassured him, holding
him close and rubbing his back and neck soothingly. It took several
minutes for Dean to calm down, even more then it had Sam which only
reinforced John's opinion that they definitely needed this time
together. "I'm right here." He soothed, holding Dean close.

When he finally had his tears under control Dean wiped at his face,
smiling a little when John handed him a bandana and not the same one
he had Sam. Once he was calm he held onto John tight for a few more
minutes, glad Sam was in the tent and couldn't see. John smiled and
kissed the side of his head. "I love you Dean." He said gently and
stood him up, refastening his jeans for him. Dean blushed a little
but gave him a shy smile. "I love you too dad." He said and reached
back, rubbing his sore rear. "Dude, remind me never to act up again
when there are switches around." He said with a grin. John laughed
and playfully smacked his head. "Deal." He winked.

"Sammy, you can come out now." He called to his youngest who came
over red eyed and sniffling again. Without even thinking, John lifted
him back into his lap and held him close. "I love you Sammy." He told
him gently. "I love you too daddy." Sammy held onto John tight for a
minute, then looked at Dean. "Are you okay?" He asked his
brother. "I'll live." Dean told him reassuringly.



Later, as John watched his boys sleep he sighed. He knew it was only
a matter of time before Sam found out what he really did, and he
actually dreaded it. But for now, he was just dad, watching his two
boys with a protectiveness that no one or nothing had better dare try
to test.

......who feels the need to take a break from an increasingly dysfunctional relationship. Original image and campaign source: reddit. Edited to add my own thoughts (not part of the original reddit call for action):  And if you do not feel like taking a total break and perhaps want just a trial separation or couple's counseling, then perhaps consider Black March Lite 2.0 = spend, but spend money on those content creators and independent retailers who came out against SOPA/PIPA.  And tell them why you're buying their products in March.  There are many of them. And for those who favor the more targeted boycott, you can find info  here.  But no matter which,  you can participate and you can tailor your level of participation.  We have the tools, the will and the strength to take a stand. Text of image Black March - Thursday March 1st 2012 to Saturday March 31st 2012 With the continuing campaigns for internet-censoring litigation such as SOPA and PIPA, and the closure of sites like Megaupload under allegations of 'piracy' and 'conspiracy' the time has come to take a stand against music, film, and media companies' lobbyists. The only way is to hit them where it hurts. Their profit margins. March 2012 is the end of the First Quarter in economic reports world wide. Do not buy a single record. Do not download a single song, legally or illegally. Do not go to see a single film in cinemas, or download a copy. Do not buy a DVD in the stores. Do not buy a videogame. Do not buy a single book or magazine. Wait the four weeks to buy them in April: see a film later, etc... Holding out for just four weeks, maximum, will leave a gaping hole in media companies profits for the first quarter, an economic hit which will in turn be observed by governments world wide as stocks and shares will blip from a large enough loss of incomes. This action will give a statement of intent: "We will not tolerate the Media Industries' lobbying for legislation that will censor the internet."

Hey all,

This is an RP that I did  and I think you'll all love it.  It's an AU with Mary alive and the boys living a fairly normal childhood.  Sam is Seven, Dean is Eleven.

Make sure you let us know what you think!

Story under cut.

    Sam Winchester fidgeted in the hard-backed office chair, backpack at his feet, nervously scanning the hallway outside through the window. He'd been sitting for about twenty minutes and normally he would have been bored to death or maybe choking because the office smelled *really* bad, like antiseptic and pencils and sweat, but this time he hadn't even noticed because his life was on the line. His *life*. The boy jerked upright in his chair at the sound of the front entrance opening, and then grinned in relief when he saw his mother through the window, heading towards the office. Thank goodness! He'd been worried that she would be out and then they would've had to call Dad at work, and then Dad would have had to leave early and Sam would never, ever, ever sit down again if *that* happened. "Mom!" The boy cried happily, only to shrink back at her stern gaze and reprimand. He fixed her with his best puppy dog eyes. "It wasn't my fault, Mom, I swear!"

    "So you didn't hit Johnny first?" She asked, having heard all of it from his teacher.
"..." Sam toed at the ground with his sneakers. They had Spiderman on the side and they lit up and they were the coolest things ever, even Dean had said he'd picked good ones. "...He hit me too!" The boy answered finally, looking up through shaggy bangs.
    "I know he did, but you hit him first." She sighed. "Come on, we're going home."
    "Can we go to McDonalds first?" Sam chirped hopefully - personally, he thought the whole getting-sent-home-early thing was pretty cool, but he'd missed lunch and he was pretty sure that the sandwich in his bag would be soggy by now.
"Absolutely not, I'll make you something when we get home." She told him, leading him to the car. Once he was in and buckled up, she got in and buckled herself up, heading home.
    "Why nooot?" Sam whined, scrunching up his face. "I don't want a stupid sandwich at home. Or soup!" He added, before Mary could suggest it.
    "Because you're in trouble, that's why. McDonalds is a treat for when you behave, not a reward for bad behavior." She explained as she turned onto their street. "And because I said no."
    "But I'm hungry!" Sam kicked the back of the seat and pouted. "I want chicken nuggets. I'm starving!"
    "Samuel Jacob." Mary warned, pulling into their driveway. "I'll make you some chicken nuggets when we get in; I bought some the other day."


    "They're not the same." Sam grumbled, snapping off his seatbelt and sliding out of the car with as much attitude as he could pack into his four-foot frame. "I don't even like those kind. I only like the McDonalds kind!"
    Having heard enough, Mary took his arm and landed two firm swats to his behind. "That's enough; you just went from being grounded for the day to being grounded for the weekend. And if you keep it up you'll get a spanking on top of it."
    Sam howled - the swats had stung but not terribly; it was more the indignation of Mom smacking him than anything. Mom was usually the one who caved when Sam - or Dean, for that matter - gave her one of their patented Winchester grins. The little boy rubbed at the seat of his pants and sulked, whining as he followed his mother inside. "That's not fair! That's three whole days Mom! I'll diiiiie!"
    Mary rolled her eyes at the dramatics. "It is fair and you won't die. Now I mean it Sammy, enough. Or do I need to give you a real spanking?" She asked, she wasn't normally the one to spank, but she had on occasion if need be.

    "No." Sam muttered sullenly, dropping his backpack in the hallway and crossing his arms over his chest. He kicked his shoes off and stomped into the living room, flopping down onto the carpet and looking at the television longingly. "What'm I supposed to do for three whole days?!"
    "You can watch one hour of TV a day, after that, read a book or play your game boy." Mary told him firmly, getting a little tired of his attitude.
    Sam should've drawn the line there, he knew - if it had been up to Dad there would have been no TV at all, and probably no game boy either, just lots of chores that even all the whining in the world wouldn't have gotten him out of. Mom was being generous - but Sam was feeling just mulish enough to huff. "But there's nothin' good on during the day and then Dean gets home and he wants to watch stupid baseball and he makes me watch it with him and my show doesn't come on till later! One hour isn't enough!"
    And that was it for Mary, grabbing his arm she sat on the couch and turned him over her lap, landing ten firm spanks to his behind. "If I hear one more word out of you about how unfair it is, you'll get a real spanking and you'll get one from your daddy when he gets home, do I make myself clear?"
    "Ow!" Sam danced from foot to foot, mutinously glaring at Mary and sniffling. He remained stubbornly silent, but caved at a warning look from Mom. His scowl deepened. "Yeah."
    At that she landed another swat. "I think you better answer me correctly."



    The little boy tried to twist away from the swat, but Mom had pretty good aim, for a girl. Rubbing at his jeans for the second time that day, Sammy nodded. "Yes, ma'am."
Mary nodded with a little smile. "Thank you."  A little later that day she was finishing up dinner while Dean watched the baseball game, and saw Sam standing in the doorway between the kitchen and the living room. "Hey kiddo, wanna help?" She asked, knowing he usually liked to help her.
    Sam just gave her a withering stare in response, as if she'd just suggested he go and stab his soccer ball with a pair of scissors. Actually, he wouldn't have minded helping (he was an excellent stirrer) but he had to remember that he was mad at Mom. Definitely mad. Yup. No way was he going to help her. "I'm going to go see *Dean*."    Mary sighed, ready to just spank his little behind. "Fine, then go see Dean." She told him, setting the table herself.

    "I *will*." Sam replied, just to get the last word. He marched into the living room and flopped onto the couch next to his big brother. "Mom's mean."
    Dean snorted, putting an arm around him. "Well what did you do? Cause mom's usually the easy one and doesn't get mean very often."

    "I didn't do nothin'!" Sam insisted. "Johnny M. was bein' a little bitch, Dean, and he was acting like a sissy so I told him to stop crying or I'd give him a reason to cry and he didn't stop even though he knows that I keep my word."

    Dean laughed. "Sammy, you can't go around hitting people, even if they are little bitches. Believe me, all it gets you is a sore butt. Cause dad swings a mean hand, and paddle." He told him.

"Dean! Language." Mary scolded gently. Sam grinned toothily at his brother at Mary's warning. Then he grew serious again. "But De-ean. He hit me back! Hard!"
    Dean got serious at that. "Sammy, if you hit me I'd hit you back, right?"
    "Yeah, 'course Dean." Sam nodded. "We're brothers."

    "Well if I'd hit you, don't you think some kid is gonna hit you harder? I mean come on dude, I go easy on you, cause you're my brother. But another kid? They won't, so you don't go around hitting people, okay?"
    Sam tilted his head to the side, the way he did when he was thinking really hard. Finally he nodded, shaggy hair flopping with the movement. "Okay, Dean." he smiled at his brother, just as the rumbling sound of the Impala sounded from the driveway.

    "Good, cause I don't wanna get in trouble for having to beat up someone for hitting you." Dean explained, as he was ferociously protective of his little brother.
    "I wouldn't tell, Dean." Sammy promised, tucking closer to Dean. The front door opened and John appeared a few moments later, obviously tired but smiling. "Hey, boys." He greeted. "Who's winning, Dean-o?"

    "The Yankees." Dean said in obvious disgust. Mary came over then, giving John a kiss on the cheek. "How was work?" She asked.
    "Work was work." He replied, looping an arm around her and walking with her back to the kitchen. "How was your day?"
    Mary sighed, leaning on him. "Your son has been driving me insane most of the day. He got suspended; Sammy got suspended from school for starting a fight. And then he had the nerve to be angry with me because I grounded him and wouldn't get McDonalds, so he's been a brat all day."
    "Why are they always my sons when they get in trouble?" John asked with a grin, before sobering. He glanced toward the living room. "You do anything about it, Mar?"
    "Gave him a few swats, and a mild spanking, but it hasn't really improved his attitude.  And they're your sons because they take after you." She grinned.


    John nodded and rolled his eyes at her last comment before turning and yelling, "Sammy! C'mere for a minute."
    Sam appeared within a few seconds, looked up at John. "Uh-huh?"
    "I hear you've been giving your mother a tough time - I didn't know you were in trouble, son, or I would have put a stop to the baseball marathon. I don't want you watching that television got it? You don't get a break at home when you're in trouble at school." John speared the boy with a level look.
    Sam's mouth dropped open and he just barely managed to refrain from stamping his foot. "No fair! Mom said I could watch TV!"

    Mary sighed. "I said an hour Sam, and it's been an hour."     "And you don't give me lip when I tell you something." John reminded him, landing a powerful swat.
    Sam squealed at the hard smack to his bottom and fixed his dad with a tearful look. "I wasn't givin' lip! I was just... 'spressing my opinion!" This was totally unfair. Mom and Dad were ganging up on him!

Mary sighed, the teary eyes always tugged at her heartstrings, whether it was Sam or Dean.  "Dinner's ready, so let's just eat.  Dean! Come sit down please." She called to her oldest.
    Dean came in and Sammy used him for cover, keeping his butt out of target range as he scooted to the table. He sat down and then announced, "I'm not hungry. Can I be excused?"

    "No you may not, your mother worked hard on this dinner and you are going to eat it." John informed him. "Now sit down."
    Sam flopped back in his chair and skewered John with a look that was frighteningly fierce on his small face. "You shouldn't make someone eat if they're not hungry, Dad."
    "And if you don't pipe down I'm going to make you eat standing up, because you won't be able to sit." John said sternly.

    Mary, who had set everything down sighed for probably the hundredth time that day. "John, if he's not hungry just let him go, I'll warm him up something later."
    "This isn't a restaurant Mary. You've done enough today, you don't need to be catering to a picky little boy." He raised an eyebrow at Sam and silently dished the boy's plate up, placing it in front of the grade-schooler. Sam glowered at the plate like it was his mortal enemy.
    Mary looked at him. "Sammy, please just eat for mommy, okay?
"
    "I'm. Not. HUNGRY!" Sam hollered, picking up his fork and throwing it down onto the table. It bounced with a loud clatter and catapulted into Dean's mashed potatoes. His brother looked both awed and horrified at the outburst. "Dude." He breathed. Sammy's ass was grass, no doubt about it.

    "That's it." John said, picking Sam up with one arm, and landing two sharp swats to his small behind with his other hand as he carried him from the table and upstairs. "I don't know who the heck you think you are little boy, but tantrums like that only get you a spanking, and combined with the way you've been treating your mother, you're in for a good one." He admonished, carrying him into his bedroom and shutting the door behind him.    "Nooo!" Sam wailed, squirming in John's arms. "Daddy I'm sorry!"
"Sorry you're in trouble maybe." John remarked, taking a seat on the bed with Sam standing in front of him. Wasting no time he pulled down his elastic shorts and his underwear, pulling him over his lap and starting to spank his little behind.

    Sam, true to form, started hollering almost immediately, bucking and kicking like a feral cat in a trap. "Owww, no Daddy! St-sto-oop!"
    "I'll stop when I think you've learned your lesson." John told him, holding him tightly and continuing to spank his behind. Covering it thoroughly, but making sure the swats were meant for a seven year old, he tipped him forward.

    Sammy was soon well and truly crying and he let out a miserable wail as he was shifted forward. "Daa-aaddy, 'm suh-suh-sorry I pro-promise!"
    "I'm sure you are Sammy, but we're not done yet." John said gently, hating this probably more then his kid did. With an inward sigh he landed a few swats to his sit spots and thighs, then gently replaced his clothes and lifted him up. "Shhhh, all over and forgiven Sam I am."

Sam star fished across his dad's chest and sobbed piteously into the lee of the man's shoulder. He pulled back to look up at John with a tear-streaked face and stuttered out a very sad, "Th-th-that really hurt Daddy!" John gave him a small smile and kissed his flushed cheek. "I know it did, I meant it to. Next time you want to throw a tantrum I want you to think about this, okay?" He asked gently.
    Sam sniffled and nodded, breath hitching and making his chest jerk. "Yes sir." he whispered, ducking his head back against John's chest.
    John smiled and held him, rubbing his back soothingly. "I love you Sam I am." He reminded him.  "Think you can go down and tell mommy you're sorry for being mean to her all day?" He asked gently.

    "I love you too Daddy." Sam replied, snuggling closer. He answered the second question with little nod, but made no move to squirm away from his father's hold.
    John understood, and stood with Sam protectively in his arms. Going downstairs he held him on his hip and looked at his wife. "Mary, Sammy has something he'd like to say to you."

    "He does huh." She smiled, looking at her youngest warmly. "'m sorry Mommy." Sam whispered, blushing and looking down. He picked at the collar of John's t-shirt and bit his lip, risking a quick look up at his mother before dropping his gaze again. "Forgiven baby." She promised, kissing his cheek. "Now how about you get some dinner, hmm?" Sammy sighed in relief and nodded, practically diving from John's arms down to Mary to give her a hug. Once she'd set him down he trundled back over to his seat. Dean handed him his fork, and Sammy grinned. "Don't worry Dean, it wouldn'ta gotcha. I have perfect aim."

You know, I swore I was going to keep this journal updated lol.  Well things here are okay, I'm working on my prompt fic, I think it'll be more a drabble though because I just can't get into writing long stories anymore, I don't know why.  I'm working on it Minx I promise lol.  The kids are good, Tyler broke his wrist a couple weeks ago but he's doing okay.  Poor kid, a broken wrist in the summer it sucks.  Anyhow, Getting off now but wanted to update.
So my CT-Scan came back negative, but they've now scheduled me for an Colonoscopy.  Yuck.  Just letting everyone know.

Hey guys,

So far I don't know anything.  Had a CT-Scan done so they can figure it out.  That sucked.  Had to drink this Barium Sulfate stuff, GROSS.   Now, we wait.  Jake's trying to be calm and strong for me, but I know he's just as scared as I am.  My husband is a sweetheart.  The one thing I did do, is update my will.  I know it's morbid, but I'm not taking any chances.  I have four babies and even though they aren't really babies anymore, the thought of leaving them scares the HELL out of me.  I don't know what's wrong with me, so I'm scared shitless.  I could seriously use some prayers for those of you who are religious, and some good thoughts for those of you who aren't.  

I'm trying so hard to be calm and not worry, but anyone who knows me knows I'm a worry wart, always have been.   I'm scared, I've never been this scared before and I don't know what to do.  

Anyhow, thanks for listening and you guys on the f-list are great.  Could use some stories though, if anyone's willing.  Some Dean-John ones or both boys and John.  Thanks.

Love to you all,

Kat.

Without the sex, yes, no sex written by Kat.  Can't do it guys, at least not Wincest, or even implied Wincest.  While I love her series, I think I love it most because in her series John is NOT their biological father.  It's awesome that way. 

So anyway, I have this fic and I'm going to need a beta when it's done, any takers?

Okay, going to bed now but wanted to post.
